markdownRemark.html:
I started out this year unemployed and depressed. I quit my job in August of 2017 and took several months off to take some trips and figure out what I wanted out of my next job.

As I worked through my depression and felt the helplessness lift off my shoulders, I started to feel very motivated to find my next challenge. I had always worked for small companies and while working through my depression, I realized that a big source of stress of me had been that I would often end up feeling like I had no one to reach out at work when overwhelmed with work. I'd be known as the one that gets stuff done and usually quickly. This led to me being placed in a lot of high pressure situations where I felt I had no one to turn to. It felt as if it were all on me.

So, in January 2018, I decided I needed to prioritize my mental health more in my next position. We all get stressed at work - at normal life things.
